Description: Rim sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of lotus flower in added white outline with added red centres; exterior: dot and billet pattern at rim above broken maeander running left between pairs of dilute lines; below, on left, part of corner roundel as filling ornament and on right, vertical dividing band of broken maeander and dot and billet pattern; on far right, part of large maeander.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes this sherd as being in the Mature Animal Style. The metopal pattern consisting of dividing bands and large maeander pattern is more consistent with the earlier Wild Goat Style, yet the interior decoration reflects the Mature Animal Style. This sherd likely belongs to a chalice late in the Wild Goat Style and may mark a transition to the Mature Animal Style.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 260, no. 510)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0393) (phase 2)
